page.title: 12SISKIN VISITS SPITSAND
page.content: Spithead, where the "flower" of Henry the Eighth's fleet, the Mary Rose was lost by disastrous mishap, lies within our 'D' block. So too does one of Lord Palmerston's infamous Spithead Forts. Spitsand or Spitbank Fort is now privately owned,having been bought from the Ministry of Defence several years ago. Siskin School as part of the Domesday Project caught a ferry from Gosport Ferry,via Clarence Pier to 'take a jolly to Palmerston's Folly'.This massive Victorian island is built in the sea about one mile (or 10 minutes by ferry) from Portsmouth.
